quest.name: A Divine Dilemma
journal: Krile wishes to take stock of the situation.

Having taken stock of the situation, Krile declares that she will remain in the Omphalos for a time to explore. In the meantime, G'raha Tia wishes to investigate the worship of the Twelve across Eorzea, and invites you and Deryk to accompany him.

By learning about the Twelve as They are worshipped, G'raha hopes to identify any similarities or differences between Them and the beings you encountered; in so doing, he believes you will draw closer to the truth of their identities. Your mission thus established, you set out first for Rhalgr's Reach, the holy ground for disciples of the Destroyer.

Upon arriving at your destination, Deryk states that those places where phantom realm sightings are known to occur often have a tradition of Twelve worship. Encouraged by this fact, you split up to seek out people who may possess knowledge about the local faith.

Among a few other details, your search has yielded a copy of Destructivity, a rare surviving scripture of the Fist of Rhalgr. Satisfied with the fruits of your efforts, you go to reconvene with your comrades at Starfall.

Skimming over the scripture, G'raha Tia finds an account of the construction of the great image of the Destroyer. The text states that, among the refugees who followed Rhalgr's comet to safety during the Sixth Umbral Calamity, some few claimed to have caught sight of the divinity Himself. Yet even as you struggle to decide whether the mysterious beings gave rise to their respective faiths or were born of them, Rhalgr and Byregot appear before you once more, in the form of a hawk and a spriggan respectively. The two explain that mortals may catch glimpses of them in their true forms when the aether surrounding their sanctums becomes unstable─a phenomenon known to occur during an Umbral Calamity. Having shared this detail in lieu of an apology for their earlier deception, the pair then take their leave. As you discuss these revelations, Krile contacts you with word that she has recruited an acquaintance to your cause─an authority on mythology. While G'raha Tia takes himself to the Sunken Temple of Qarn to receive this individual, you are tasked with going ahead to Ul'dah with Deryk to make inquiries about Nald'thal.
Though Deryk has agreed to accompany you, his apprehension towards the idea is plain to see. Whatever may be the source of his discomfiture, for now you decide to focus on the task at hand.
objectives: Wait at the designated location in Rhalgr's Reach.
Make inquiries on the Fist of Rhalgr.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: 'Tis well Krile could make her way here quickly.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: She's another one of your colleagues, I take it?

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Greetings. I am Krile, of the Students of Baldesion. Do I have the pleasure of addressing Deryk, the explorer who sought aid in investigating this place?

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: Aye, I am Deryk. And this here is a baby opo-opo.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Yes, I can see that. Doesn't it have a name?

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: None that I know of. Nor would I presume to bestow one, for that would be condescending.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: I see. That's very considerate of you.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: So, I understand you explored the various phantom realms with Deryk. Will you recount to me the experience?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: So while the gods tested you sorely, you did not sense any malicious intent...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: As Byregot said, they wish to do battle with us. But 'twould seem they do not necessarily wish to cause us harm.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Though much and more about this perplexes, mayhap 'tis safe to assume that they are not primals.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: As you may recall, Livingway once told us that the art of summoning as taught by the Ascians incorporates the fervent desire to assimilate others into one's belief.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Thus do the resultant primals seek to enthrall worshipers, who in turn seek to grow their ranks.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: But these beings appear to harbor no such desire. If they are primals, then they are unlike those that have been summoned in recent memory.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: We might suppose that they were created in antiquity in like manner to Hydaelyn, but there is no way to prove it.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Who could they possibly be? And why do they desire battle with man?

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: (-Emet-Selch-)Even of your little Eorzea, you know precious little. The true identities of the Twelve, for instance.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Emet-Selch did say that, didn't he?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: By which we may assume he knew the truth...and challenged you to seek it out too. Suffice it to say you'll do so, of course?

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Insofar as we can ascertain, this is a matter which has implications for the entire star. In light of this, the Students of Baldesion formally accept the commission. We will investigate the phantom realm and the beings who call themselves the Twelve.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: I'm pleased to hear that. Thank you.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Without further ado, then, I will take a look around. There are a few things I'm curious about.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Then with your permission, I will take myself around Eorzea and investigate the worship of those gods we encountered.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Forename, Deryk. Seeing as you've already seen this place, would you care to accompany me?

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: By all means. In which case...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: To be deleted.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: Could you stay here with Krile, my friend? It wouldn't do to leave a fair maiden alone.

dialogue.name: BABYOPOOPO
dialogue.text: Ook ook!

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Hehe, I shall be glad for the company. Take care, then, and good luck.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Raha has also shared his observations with me. Keeping your combined accounts in mind, I shall see what else I can learn here.

dialogue.name: BABYOPOOPO
dialogue.text: (-Baby Opo-opo-)Ook!

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: Shall we ask G'raha Tia about his plan?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: So, to explain my plan...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: 'Tis believed that the Twelve were already worshipped during the Third Astral Era, when the Allagan Empire flourished.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Come the Fifth Astral Era, those nations that fought in the War of the Magi each took one of the Twelve as a guardian deity.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: This practice has continued to the present day in Eorzea, with some notable regional differences. For instance, Ishgardians hold Halone as absolute, while Sharlayans enjoy a moderate relationship with Thaliak.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: By visiting various locations in Eorzea and learning about the Twelve as They are worshipped, I hope to identify any similarities or differences between Them and the beings we encountered.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: In so doing, I believe we will draw closer to the truth of their identities.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: For our first destination, I propose we take ourselves to Rhalgr's Reach. The place is holy ground for worshipers of the Destroyer, and promises to yield useful details.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: There you are, Forename.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: This place served as the base of operations for your investigation into Omega, did it not? How delightful to be here together!

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: So, this is Rhalgr's Reach, where the dauntless soldiers of the Ala Mhigan Resistance gathered... How stirring to stand here with you!

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: If you don't mind my making an observation, it seems you enjoy traveling with company.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I do. It's something I had dreamed of for a long time.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: There's nothing like traveling with good friends.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I enjoy company, but sometimes I prefer my own.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: Is that so...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: What of yourself? Do you normally travel alone?

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: Aye. In my wanderings, I much prefer to have solitude.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: Not that I avoid people or communities, mind you. As a matter of fact, I've been here before, on the trail of the phantom realm.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: Hmmm, now that I think on it...

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: More often than not, those places where phantom realm sightings are known to occur have a tradition of Twelve worship.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Then I dare to hope that we are on the right track.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: As I'm sure you know, Rhalgr's Reach is home to the Temple of the Fist, the ancient headquarters of the Fist of Rhalgr.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Razed by the mad king Theodoric, the temple lay abandoned before the Ala Mhigan Resistance claimed it for its operations.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: While I doubt that much literature has survived over the years, the people here may possess some knowledge of the local faith.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: So let us split up and make inquiries, and reconvene here afterwards to share findings.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: Learned anything thus far?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You read the words inscribed on the monument...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text:
(-Bloodstorm-)A storm of blood approaches fast,
Hells open, Heavens weep.
For no one soul doth lie beyond
The measure of His Reach.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once upon a time, Lyse explained to you their meaning─that we must prepare ourselves for the strife and sorrow that will inevitably come.

dialogue.name: ALAMHIGANLIBERATOR04538
dialogue.text: Oh, if it isn't Forename! Is this man perchance a friend of yours?

dialogue.name: ALAMHIGANLIBERATOR04538
dialogue.text: When last he visited, he shared with me the tales he heard on his journeys. And what amazing tales they were!

dialogue.name: ALAMHIGANLIBERATOR04538
dialogue.text: If you have time, I'd love to hear both of your stories!

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: Alas, we're in some haste. We're investigating the worship of Rhalgr, and seek literature on the subject─religious texts and the like. Can any still be found here?

dialogue.name: ALAMHIGANLIBERATOR04538
dialogue.text: Just about all of it is gone, sadly─destroyed by the Empire if not the mad king before that.

dialogue.name: ALAMHIGANLIBERATOR04538
dialogue.text: But we haven't lost everything. The mighty image of the Destroyer... The tales we share at the campfire, like the legend of our nation's founding...

dialogue.name: ALAMHIGANLIBERATOR04538
dialogue.text: We still have these things, and they were a source of great comfort and strength to us in our darkest moments.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: I see. If you don't mind, I would be obliged to hear your stories this time.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: Forename, rest assured I have this well in hand. Feel free to carry on as you were.

dialogue.name: SCHOLAR04538
dialogue.text: ...Yes? If you have business, please make it quick. I'm due to meet with someone any moment now.

dialogue.name: MARJORIE
dialogue.text: (-???-)Forgive me my delay!

dialogue.name: MARJORIE
dialogue.text: Hm? You're an adventurer, I take it? What can we students of Ala Mhigan history do for you?

dialogue.name: MARJORIE
dialogue.text: Researching the worship of the Destroyer, you say! In that case, I have something that ought to be of interest!

dialogue.name: MARJORIE
dialogue.text: Why, if it isn't the adventurer who kindly escorted me to the Temple of the Fist! Are you studying monks too, perchance?

dialogue.name: MARJORIE
dialogue.text: If so, you ought to work together with me and my colleague here! Few things are finer than joining heads with like-minded folk!

dialogue.name: MARJORIE
dialogue.text: Researching the worship of the Destroyer, you say! Why didn't you mention it sooner!?

dialogue.name: MARJORIE
dialogue.text: This is a copy of Destructivity, a scripture of the Fist of Rhalgr. The original is one of the few texts that survived the temple's razing, and is in the safekeeping of one Professor Erik.

dialogue.name: MARJORIE
dialogue.text: This is a copy of Destructivity, a scripture of the Fist of Rhalgr. The original is one of the few texts that survived the temple's razing, and was recovered by a monk named Widargelt.

dialogue.name: MARJORIE
dialogue.text: I went to the trouble of having this made for my colleague...only for her to say she doesn't need it. So I will offer it to you instead!

dialogue.name: SCHOLAR04538
dialogue.text: <sigh> Lest you forget, this is your passion, not mine. I'm simply assisting you as a favor, and I'd thank you not to put us in danger.

dialogue.name: MARJORIE
dialogue.text: Ah, but danger is the crucible in which the monk tempers body and mind! <sigh> So sublime, monks...

dialogue.name: MARJORIE
dialogue.text: Well, we had best return to our work! Till next time, adventurer!

dialogue.name: ALAMHIGANLIBERATOR04538
dialogue.text: Next time, I hope to hear some of your stories too!

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Forename, what were you able to learn?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: A copy of one of the scriptures, you say? A moment while I skim over it!

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I see... This chapter appears to be a record of the construction of the great image of Rhalgr, written in a style that suggests folklore was committed to parchment.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: When the deluge of the Sixth Umbral Calamity threatened Eorzea, the ancestors of the Ala Mhigans were guided to safety by a comet.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Believing that it was sent by Rhalgr, they came to hold Him in the highest. This much of the tale, I had been familiar with...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: But according to the scripture, among those refugees who followed the comet, some claimed to have caught sight of Rhalgr Himself.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Their accounts were passed down through the centuries, and worshipers of the Destroyer pieced them together to give shape to yonder statue.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I must say, it bears more than a passing resemblance to the being we encountered...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Were that Rhalgr a primal, the explanation for the similarities would be simple.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: That is, the statue gives rise to a unified interpretation of Rhalgr's appearance, which in turn lends form to the primal.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: However, this fails to account for what inspired the likeness in the first place. If the scripture is to be believed, it was the sightings during the Sixth Umbral Calamity. Yet for those witnesses to be able to recognize Rhalgr, they would have needed an agreed-upon idea of His appearance beforehand.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: If we then consider the history of Twelve worship─that it already existed in the Third Astral Era─it would not be ridiculous to think that these divinities existed even prior to that.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: So the question is, did these beings give rise to their respective faiths, or are they primals born of them?

dialogue.name: RHALGR
dialogue.text: (-Rhalgr's Voice-)I thought we had made it clear. We are not summoned beings.

dialogue.name: RHALGR
dialogue.text: (-Hawk with Rhalgr's Voice-)Since time immemorial, our domains have lain scattered across Eorzea. As a matter of fact, one of those in which you set foot is nearby. 'Tis not unusual for mortals to glimpse us.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: That voice... Could they be...?

dialogue.name: BYREGOT
dialogue.text: Indeed. I am Byregot, and the hawk beside me is Rhalgr. I shall elaborate upon my master's explanation.

dialogue.name: BYREGOT
dialogue.text: We thus disguise ourselves when we wish to observe the world without, for being seen in our true forms would violate our laws of conduct.

dialogue.name: BYREGOT
dialogue.text: Yet though we similarly disguise our sanctums, veiling them in illusion, rents are known to manifest when the surrounding aether is unstable.

dialogue.name: RHALGR
dialogue.text: In such a time, should a gifted mortal chance to be near, they may inadvertently catch sight of us.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Of course! During an Umbral Calamity, aetheric imbalance occurs on a star-wide scale─the ideal condition for seeing the phantom realm!

dialogue.name: RHALGR
dialogue.text: Precisely how many times we have been seen, we ourselves have no way of knowing, but aye─that is a sound assumption to make.

dialogue.name: RHALGR
dialogue.text: Well, Byregot, I believe that much shall suffice by way of an apology for our deception. Shall we?

dialogue.name: BYREGOT
dialogue.text: Indeed, that is all we are at liberty to reveal. Fare you well, children of man.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Aside from their reticence where it concerns their identity and objective, these divinities are certainly approachable.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: If what they said was true, and their worship can be traced back to their sightings, it would serve to explain one thing.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: According to my research, in the field of comparative mythology, Rhalgr is often observed to bear many similarities with Ramuh.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Assuming both were inspired by the Rhalgr of the phantom realm...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Their divergence may be attributable to differences in culture between man and sylph.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: So you believe that they gave rise to the prevailing faiths of Eorzea?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Given available evidence, yes─I am inclined to. Yet none of this explains their presence. How and when did beings of such power come into existence?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: ...Oh, 'tis you, Krile. Has something happened?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: ...Truly!? Very well, I shall take care of it.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Krile has recruited an acquaintance to aid in our investigation─an authority on mythology.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I must go and receive her at the Sunken Temple of Qarn, where she is currently conducting fieldwork─after a brief detour to prepare...a little something.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Conveniently, Thanalan is home to countless adherents of Nald'thal. While I tend to business, may I ask the two of you to make inquiries in Ul'dah?

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: Very well...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Excellent. I will join you as soon as I'm able. By your leave...

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: So, it's to be just you and me in Ul'dah...

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: <sigh> I suppose it can't be helped...
